item.title: Brianna add a quote by Steven D. Levitt
item.description: "Morality, it could be argued, represents the way that people would like the world to work, wheareas economics represents how it actually does work." -- Steven D. Levitt

item.title: Brianna add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "Works of art, in my opinion, are the only objects in the material universe to possess internal order, and that is why, though I don't believe that only art matters, I do believe in Art for Art's sake." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: Brianna add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Brianna add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Man is what he wills himself to be." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Brianna add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Brianna add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "â€¨Loneliness is the human condition. Cultivate it. The way it tunnels into you allows your soul room to grow. Never expect to outgrow loneliness. Never hope to find people who will understand you, someone to fill that space. An intelligent, sensitive person is the exception, the very great exception. If you expect to find people who will understand you, you will grow murderous with disappointment. The best you'll ever do is to understand yourself, know what it is that you want, and not let the cattle stand in your way." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Brianna add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Brianna add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Brianna add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Brianna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "We know what we are, but not what we may be." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by Henry van Dyke
item.description: "Time is Too Slow for those who Wait, Too Swift for those who Fear, Too Long for those who Grieve, Too Short for those who Rejoice; But for those who Love, Time is not." -- Henry van Dyke

item.title: Brianna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Hell is empty and all the devils are here." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Words are easy, like the wind; Faithful friends are hard to find." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "These violent delights have violent ends And in their triump die, like fire and powder Which, as they kiss, consume" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The course of true love never did run smooth." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "In time we hate that which we often fear." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by Shakespeare William Shakespeare
item.description: "Lovers and madmen have such seething brains, Such shaping fantasies, that apprehend More than cool reason ever comprehends. The lunatic, the lover and the poet Are of imagination all compact: One sees more devils than vast hell can hold, That is, the madman: the lover, all as frantic, Sees Helen's beauty in a brow of Egypt: The poet's eye, in fine frenzy rolling, Doth glance from heaven to earth, from earth to heaven; And as imagination bodies forth The forms of things unknown, the poet's pen Turns them to shapes and gives to airy nothing A local habitation and a name." -- Shakespeare William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "I love thee, I love thee with a love that shall not die. Till the sun grows cold and the stars grow old." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Brianna add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "That is part of the beauty of all literature. You discover that your longings are universal longings, that you're not lonely and isolated from anyone. You belong." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Brianna add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I fell in love with her courage, her sincerity, and her flaming self respect. And it's these things I'd believe in, even if the whole world indulged in wild suspicions that she wasn't all she should be. I love her and it is the beginning of everything." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Brianna add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know, is that the sentimental person thinks things will last--the romantic person has a desperate confidence that they won't." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Brianna add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Cut out all these exclamation points. An exclamation point is like laughing at your own joke." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Brianna add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Here's to alcohol, the rose colored glasses of life." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Brianna add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "In his blue gardens men and girls came and went like moths among the whisperings and the champagne and the stars." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Brianna add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description:
"Think how you love me,' she whispered. 'I don't ask you to love me always like this, but I ask you to remember.'
You'll always be like this to me.'
Oh no; but promise me you'll remember.' Her tears were falling. 'I'll be different, but somewhere lost inside me there'll always be the person I am tonight." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Brianna add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Books are the treasured wealth of the world and the fit inheritance of generations and nations." -- Henry David Thoreau
